message.content:
cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.PR. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating the first passage time of a random walk observed in a noisy or delayed fashion. This problem is relevant to several areas of computer science, including control systems (cs.SY), information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), numerical analysis (cs.NA), and probability (cs.PR). The paper uses optimization techniques to derive optimal stopping rules and bounds on the estimation error, which are common tools in these areas. Therefore, it is likely that the paper could be classified under any of these sub-categories, with cs.SY and cs.IT being the most likely due to the focus on control and information aspects of the problem.
